instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead SSD
threads.message:
Hello, 
I am wondering is it possible to replace SSD IC's on this boards or they linked to the components on the board like an iPhone memory? If it is possible would be a donor board where I should look for this NAND IC's ? 
The <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> was liquid damaged and SSD lines PP2V5 are shorted to the ground, short check showing  NAND are dead warming up when 2 V injected to this line 
Thanks for help

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead SSD
threads.message:
Yes, you can replace them.
You can buy complete kit on Aliexpress, already initialized.

Also can get them from donor board, not the same model.
01041 and other models can serve for this purpose.
Be aware to place them in the same sequence.
If your board has 5 NAND chips, need to remove and left empty the 5th one.

Be aware of actual SSD size configuration of your machine, to get the correct replacement NANDs.
